item.title: PBIS Initiatives at Copperview
item.description: Solving the Behavior Puzzle

item.title: Middle School Schedule
item.description: When I was in the EBL Department, the other specialists and I spent months working on a middle school schedule to prepare for the reconfiguration when 6th grade would move into the middle school and 9th grade would move into the high school. Leslie Allen and I worked hard with School Performance Director Mike Sirois to create a schedule that would allow built-in time for students to have remediation and enrichment in ELA and Math courses.

item.title: My Experiences in Russia
item.description: Over a decade ago, I served a mission for my Church. In Russia. In Siberia. It was amazing. I loved the time I spent there. It was wonderful, and I love the people that I met.

item.title: Noisy Kids
item.description: Tonight, after dinner while Staci and I were cleaning up dinner, the kids were running around the entire house like crazy people. The squealing and laughter was non-stop, and I know there are people that would tell the kids to hush.

item.title: Storylines
item.description: Have You Experienced a Storyline?

item.title: Grade-wide Data in a New Look
item.description: At our school, we do "Curriculum Conferences" or "Academic Parent-Team Meetings". These are an extra parent-teacher conference-like setup that was pioneered by the Harvard Family Research Project. The idea is that we focus on student data during our discussions with the families.

item.title: IPST Data Forms
item.description: Here is the file that teachers need to download to enter data for weekly IPST (Instructional Problem Solving Team Meetings)

item.description: Here's how to get rid of pesky silent spots in Skype (and other) recordings.

item.title: Fixing my Errors
item.description: I am hosting this blog on Github Pages and I am learning a lot about ruby, web development, git, commits, pulls, and more. There is still a lot I don't know, but it is fun to learn about it.

item.title: Accountability Movement
item.description: I recently wrote this blog post about the accountability movement in education. I think that we need to understand why it exists and own our reasons for what we think about it.

item.title: New Setup
item.description: I have always wanted a sweet dual-monitor setup, and I finally found a good deal on two monitors. And, since the wife and I just finished paying off all our student loan debt, I was stoked to be able to have some cash to pay for it.

item.description: I finally got the RSS feed working tonight. That is pretty exciting for me, because I have no idea what I am doing.

item.title: Transformative Principal Podcast
item.description: I started a podcast. In it, I interview transformative principals that are making a real difference in their students' lives.
